newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Bahrain sets conditions for welcoming Qatari emir.
newsitem.headline: Bahrain sets conditions for welcoming Qatari emir.

text.p: Bahrain said on Monday it would welcome Qatar's Emir Sheikh Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani if he had practical ideas for settling a border dispute.
"Bahrain welcomes receiving Qatar's emir if he carries with him a practical initiative over disputes between the two countries," Information Minister Mohammad Ibrahim al-Mutawae told Reuters.

Mutawae was commenting on remarks in a Kuwaiti newspaper published on Monday which quoted Sheikh Hamad as saying he was ready to visit Bahrain to persuade it not to boycott Saturday's Gulf Arab summit.

"If my brothers in Bahrain would agree, I have no objection to go in person to Bahrain to invite (Bahrain's Emir) Sheikh Isa (bin Sulman al-Khalifa) to attend the Gulf Summit," Sheikh Hamad told the daily al-Qabas.

Bahrain has said it would not attend the annual summit of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) -- grouping Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates -- due to be held in the Qatari capital Doha on December 7.
Qatar and Bahrain are locked in a territorial dispute over a group of barren islands, reefs and sandbanks in the Gulf controlled by Bahrain since the 1930s but also claimed by Qatar.

Qatar has taken the dispute to the International Court of Justice in The Hague. The move has angered Bahrain which insists on a Gulf Arab solution. Qatar has said it would only withdraw the case if Saudi Arabia's mediation was successful.
Bahrain said on Monday it had arrested two Qataris on charges of spying for Qatar, a small peninsula on the east coast of Saudi Arabia.
